Latest News

Native Sons 3CD Expanded Box Set

Released January 19th, the long-awaited expanded edition of The Long Ryders debut album Native Sons is Out Now. Compiled in conjunction with the band, this new 3CD edition contains the original album alongside a raft of demos, B-sides, and a scorching live recording from 1985.

Described at the time by Melody Maker as a âmodern American classicâ this is the album which kick-started Americana and put the âaltâ into Alt-Country! Native Sons was a number one USA indie/alternative album and a number two in the UK (to Meat Is Murder) and you can pre-order this 3CD box set from Cherry Red Records at cherryred.co/NativeSons

Order Now

A key foundation stone of Americana and alt-country movements of today this was a popular indie/college radio release in the USA and a huge indie album in Europe when originally released. Via a remastered album, a CD of demos and outtakes, and a CD from a blistering live show in London in â85 you can now hear why. And how! ð¸ ð¥ ð¶

The 10 Best Americana Albums Of All Time

The Long Ryders feature at no less than number five in uDiscoverMusic's 'The 10 Best Americana Albums Of All Time'

"5: The Long Ryders: State Of Our Union (1985)

Unlike many of the best Americana albums on this list, this album wasnât a big hit, nor did the band ever have one. The Long Ryders were well aware that they were crying into the wilderness. The 80s just werenât a great time for a band that revered Gram Parsons and Buffalo Springfield, but thatâs precisely what gives State Of Our Union its urgency.

The other big element in their mix was full-throttle garage rock, and it all comes together on the 12-string-driven âCapturing The Flag.â Without exaggeration, itâs as great a song as Springfield and the Burritos ever wrote. Another high point of the album is the celebratory âLooking For Lewis And Clark,â which namechecks Parsons, Tim Hardin, and âLouie Louie.â In the last-laugh department, The Long Ryders have reunited and have a new album on the way."

Sid had this to say "To see this in Apple News today, Sept 30, is pretty meaningful to me. When released the Long Rydersâ State Of Our Union LP it got mediocre reviews from the UK press but was a Number One college radio album in the USA and a particularly big seller in, yes sir, Spain."

"So to read Brett Milanoâs thoughtful reappraisal is quite a moment for me but no, I confess I do not think it is a better album than the Burritosâ Gilded Palace Of Sin. (One day I will call a solo album The Gilded Palace Of Sid.) Do please read Mr Milanoâs note and enjoy the entire article. BTW, there is now a three CD box set edition of this very album available via Cherry Red Records. Just sayinâ"

Read the full article here.

The Long Ryders Sign New Administration Agreement With Limited Edition Music Publishing

Los Angeles, CA - April 12, 2023 - The Long Ryders, the legendary American alternative country and rock band have signed a worldwide administration agreement with Limited Edition Music Publishing. The new deal covers the band's entire music catalog, including future releases.

Limited Edition Music Publishing will handle all aspects of The Long Ryders' song catalog including licensing, synchronization and royalty collections. This ensures the band's music will continue to be marketed and promoted on a worldwide basis. The band is about to embark on a UK and European tour to promote their new album September November on Cherry Red Records. Their world tour continues through 2024.

âI know all the Long Ryders are thrilled to have signed with Limited Edition Music Publishing," said Sid Griffin. "Their extensive knowledge of our music and their expertise in this industry make them the perfect partner for us. I mean perfect, too. We cannot wait to start working with them and bringing our music to a new generation of fans.â

Stephen McCarthy added âMarc and Greg are the perfect publishers for the Long Ryders. Their passion and experience from the street level up are key. Plus, it doesnât hurt to have one of your publishers behind the songs and behind the drum kit every night!â

Limited Edition Music Publishing is equally excited about the partnership. "We are honored to be working with The Long Ryders, a uniquely original and important band that has been making music for over forty years. They played a pivotal role in shaping the alternative country and americana music genres," said Marc Wilson, Co-President of Limited Edition Music. "We are committed to helping them reach new heights by making their music even more accessible to fans all over the world."

The Long Ryders formed in Los Angeles in 1982 and have released a number of critically acclaimed albums throughout their career, including "Native Sons", "State of Our Union" and their just released new album âSeptember November.â They are the recipients of the Americana UK Music Associationâs 2022 International Trailblazer award and are currently featured in the Country Music Hall of Fameâs âWestern Edgeâ exhibit. Their music has been described as a blend of americana, rock, punk and country, and continues to influence artists all over the world.

Western Edge: The Roots and Reverberations of Los Angeles Country-Rock

The Long Ryders were pleased to be rightfully included in the Country Music Hall Of Fame in Nashville USA for their impressive Western Edge: The Roots and Reverberations of Los Angeles Country-Rock exhibit.

This exhibit will last three years, until May 2025, at the Country Music Hall Of Fame and to see the Long Ryders photo and various bits of memorabilia next to material from The Byrds, Emmylou Harris, Michael Nesmithâs First National Band, Lucinda Williams, Dwight Yoakam, Linda Ronstadt, Buffalo Springfield, Los Lobos and so many other famous names was a true thrill.

Please check out the exhibit if and when you can. Everyone is raving about it and you can learn so much!

The Country Music Hall Of Fame website has this to say about the exhibit: "Western Edge: The Roots and Reverberations of Los Angeles Country-Rock traces communities of visionary singers, songwriters, and musicians who set about reinvigorating the sounds of pop and rock by infusing elements of country, bluegrass, and folk music. Fostered in local nightclubs and late-night jam sessions, the resulting musical fusion, âcountry-rock,â made a lasting impact on popular music.

The exhibit surveys the rise of the Byrds, Buffalo Springfield, the Flying Burrito Brothers, Poco, Eagles, Emmylou Harris, Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, Linda Ronstadt and many others who, in the 1960s and â70s, found commercial success with new sounds that merged rock & roll rhythms and attitude with country and bluegrass instrumentation and harmonies. As they flourished, so did the Los Angeles-based recording industry.

These trailblazersâ musical contributions were expanded upon by the next generation of Los Angeles roots music performersâthe Blasters, Rosie Flores, Los Lobos, Lone Justice, Dwight Yoakam, and moreâwho once again looked to traditional American music for inspiration. Blending hard-edged honky-tonk, Mexican folk music, rockabilly, and punk rock, these artistsâalong with their country-rock predecessorsâprovided inspiration to future generations of country and Americana artists."

International Trailblazers - The Long Ryders

The Long Ryders were pleased and proud to receive the International Trailblazer Award, an award presented to an "International artist, duo or group that has taken an exceptional path, inspiring others in the Americana genre" from the Americana Music Association UK last month.

While all the band were unable to be there in person due to the Covid related cancellation of the full awards show. Sid stepped up to accept the award in person from the great Nick Stewart and both Greg and Stephen beamed their thanks into the show... View the acceptance speech at this link.

I sang 2 duets with Carla Olson. The opening track is a new version of a Long Ryders song of mine called Here comes that train again. We also cover I remember the railroad by Gene Clark. Carla produced the album which also features cuts by John Fogerty, Dave Alvin, Peter Case et."

From The Observer, March 6, 2022...

Tom-Tom

A year ago our longtime bass player and dear friend Tom Stevens died. He was a terrific person, a devoted husband and father, and the best bass player of his generation in Los Angeles. Wanting to do a song in his honour but, aware of Covid, the Long Ryders were forced to email sound files back-and-forth till we had something we all liked.

This song went from Greg in Los Angelesâ¦the lyrics coming to him in a dreamâ¦to Stephen in Virginia, to Ed Stasium near San Diego and then to Sid in London, England.

Despite us being in four different locations the Long Ryders feel they came up with something pretty special.

Ride into the sunset for Outlaw Country West, a new festival cruising from Los Angeles to Cabo San Lucas and Ensenada, Mexico, November 3-8, 2022, with an epic lineup celebrating Californiaâs Country Rock and Cow Punk legacy. Join the pre-sale at outlawcountrywest.com

Down To The Well - Out Now!

"Feeling the impending weight of an ill wind about to blow as the country grows more and more divided. So many have sold their soul and to what end? With a thirst for knowledge & a desire for reconciliation Iâm going Down to the well."

Stephen McCarthy

Attention all rockers, quarantine kids and Long Ryder fans ... new single âDown To The Wellâ b/w new remix of âIf You Want To See Me Cryâ is out now!

We recorded most of âDown To The Wellâ long distance. The band emailed sound files back-and-forth till we had something we all liked. Some of the basic tracks were recorded live in Richmond, Virginia. The song was written in December 2016 and recorded mid-February 2017. All Aboard - Lockdown Video

Friends, fans of popular music, and those reading this aloud to their captive household, the Long Ryders are proud to announce they have a new video for their song All Aboard. The tune was of course found on their number one album (official UK Americana chart, Amazon American/alt-country chart too) Psychedelic Country Soul, and emanates from a demo Tom Stevens sent to Sid a little over four years ago.

As each Long Ryder was in lockdown anyway there was no reason for concern about not getting together. With no budget and not much foresight the band decided to enter into the spirit of combating coronavirus by each band member recording themselves on a cell phone. Edited by ace filmmaker Chris Hathway the finished product is slated to do the rounds of film festivals worldwide when the lockdown endsâ¦and as Sid points out, the lockdown will end. So, with a musical version of the Dunkirk spirit, pressing us forward, here it is. All Aboard!

In the meantime we can also announce the long-awaited box set of Native Sons is in the works!

Compiled by the bandâs erudite archivist, Tom Stevens, it will consist of three discs. The first will be a remastered version of the album with a few outtakes, the second will be further outtakes and a few demos from the early 1984 demo sessions at Vitus Matareâs studio, and the third disc is a red-hot live in concert performance from the bandâs autumn â84 tour to support their most successful album. Alas, this Native Sons box set will not appear on the market till late 2021 at the earliest as it takes quite some time to compile the photographs and sort out the legalities.

By the way, if anyone has photos of the Long Ryders from this era (1984) they would loan us for this Native Sons box set then please, please, pleaseâ¦as James Brown once sangâ¦get them to Sid G or Tom Stevens soon as you can! Many thanks indeed.

The Long Ryders send love & light to you all.

Stay safe, stay home, wash those hands! Remember... rock and roll kills germs on contact!
